required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mid-term Survival and Quality of Life of Elderly Patients Undergoing Open Heart Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Mid -Term Survival and Quality of Life of Elderly Patients Undergoing Open Heart Surgery

oversight_info.authority: Israel: Ministry of Health - Director General

brief_summary.textblock: The purposes of the investigators study is to examine the overall survival and quality of life in elderly patients (> 75 years) undergoing open heart surgery at Hadassah medical center between 2008-2011. All alive patients will be phone interviewed using the 36-item short form health survey. Results will be compared to similar health survey results (36-SF)obtained from a group of Israeli adults who had no open heart surgery (controlled group). The investigators hypothesize that elderly patients achieve improvement in quality of life after open heart surgery with acceptable operative morbidity and mortality.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients age >75 y who underwent open hear surgeary
arm_group.description: The cohort study consist of all patients > 75 y, undergoing open heart surgery between 2008-2011 at Hadassah medical center.

intervention.arm_group_label: Patients age >75 y who underwent open hear surgeary

study_pop.textblock: All patients age >75 y who underwent open heart surgery between 2008-2011 at hadassah medical center.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all patients age > 75 years who discharged alive after surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- death
